Big_Bear_Scot

Well I give a monkies about the Scottish Election, I will vote SNP.
 
 The best way to solve the 'West Lothian Question' is to break up the UK, that way we can never have Scottish MPs vote on purely English matters. :)
 
 On a more serious note those who want to save the Union should advocate some sort of Federal System for the UK. At the moment you have English Nationalists who feel they have been marginalised by Devolution in Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales. The English should have their own Parliament which has oversight on Education, Transport etc(the same powers as the Scottish Parliament) and the UK Parliament should only deal with Defence and Foreign Affairs. 
 
 I don't see MPs voting for this however, it would be like the 'Turkey's voting for Christmas'
 
 We have actually been canvassed by the BNP as well, I think they are trying re-brand themselves as a genuine right wing party because of Cameron's Tories move to the Centre ground. I basically told the BNP activist where to go, that in no way I could ever support their Racist Agenda. I then ripped up their leaflet and threw it in the bin.

 Scanning through the bumpf that's dropped through the letterbox it all seems very light on policy. They seem more concerned with a biography of the candidate which in virtually all cases can be summed up as follows;
 
 Name of party
 photo of candidate
 Candidate grew up on a farm
 photo of candidate shaking hands with Blair/Cameron/Campbell
 AS a boy candidate went to school (No, really?!?)

 candidate cares about you, vote for us...
 
 Repeat in Welsh.
 
 Politics seems to have been replaced with "Pick your own farmboy" here...

Big_Bear_Scot

Well I voted today.
 
 In Scotland we have a bit more complicated Election system than the rest of the UK, I had 3 votes today.
 
 The 1st vote is the traditional 'first past the post' system where your vote for a Constituency MSP.
 2nd vote is the regional top up list using the additional member system, where you vote for a political party.
 3rd vote was for the Local Council using the Single Transferable vote system, where you rank your candidates by preference(1st choice would be 1, 2nd choice would be 2 etc etc)
 
 My first and second vote went to the SNP and my last voted I ranked the candidates in the following preference
 
 SNP - 1
 Labour - 3
 Tory - (left blank)
 Lib Dem - 2
 
 On Election night I usually stay up and watch the coverage, so I might post on this topic at an ungodly hour.
Ripskar

Well the Conservatives have taken my Asembly seat which isn't an entirely unexpected result.
 Good to Labour getting a kicking.
 
 Sounds like there's problems with the Scottish voting system, and you're going to get a hung parliament. (If only it had happened in a General Election)
Big_Bear_Scot

Sounds like there's problems with the Scottish voting system, and you're going to get a hung parliament. (If only it had happened in a General Election)

 
 http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/shared/vote2007/scottish_parliment/html/region_99999.stm
 
 We could still get to the point where the SNP or Labour will be the largest party in the Parliament, the Lib Dems will be the King makers again. It also seems like the SNP are picking up a lot of seats from the PR regional lists, this could mean that they caould be largest party by the end of today.
 
 There where two main problems with the voting system, first they decided to run the Local Council elections on the same day as the Scottish Parliament system under a new voting system(Single Transferable Vote) this has caused confusion amongst voters. Also the ballot papers are being counted electronically for the first time, some of the central machines that have collated results have failed, and this has resulted in delays in the counts in a few Constituencies. It seems like there could be over 100,000 spoiled ballots in the Scottish Parliament election.

Britain's untrumpeted success is introducing of Islam in Baltic states, Estonia and other. My friends living there are stayng in shock. Islamic organizations have been mushrooming lately there. Many of them have turned out to be just branches of the notoriously known Hizb-ut-Tahrir. According to many experts it's terrorist's beehive just! So terrorist centers under the guise of Islamic organizations and mosques are being planted in Baltic states. I suspect in Moldova they are planning same sort of thing. I wonder why is EU having a blind eye on it?

They are mostly students from Near East. I suspect IHRC (surely sponsored by British intelligence) is going to use them as the fifth column to instigate violence here and then to meddle into the mess as the defender of 'oppressed Muslims'. The scenario is really bad. Just fancy those mosques in Moldova. They have always been breeding soil for radical Islamists.
